cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 285 miles E of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, then turning west toward the lower Texas coast and inland into northern Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south of Corpus Christi, near Baffin Bay/Padre Island National Seashore, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to San Luis Pass, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from the mouth of the Rio Grande northward to High Island, with heavy rain spreading to the upper Texas and Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤8%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy onshore flow possible late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (generally below 3 ft) with elevated surf and rip currents along the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with localized higher totals could produce flash flooding in the Port Arthur area Saturday through early Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated wave action that could affect port operations and vessel handling.
